nfs4_op_readdir.c

Go to the documentation of this file.

00112 #define arg_READDIR4 op->nfs_argop4_u.opreaddir
00113 #define res_READDIR4 resp->nfs_resop4_u.opreaddir
00114 
00115 extern time_t ServerBootTime ;
00116 
00129 int nfs4_op_readdir(  struct nfs_argop4 * op ,   
00130                       compound_data_t   * data,
00131                       struct nfs_resop4 * resp)
00132 {
00133   cache_entry_t    * dir_pentry = NULL ;
00134   cache_entry_t    * pentry = NULL ;
00135   
00136   cache_inode_endofdir_t eod_met ;
00137   fsal_attrib_list_t     attrlookup ;
00138   cache_inode_status_t   cache_status ;
00139   cache_inode_status_t   cache_status_attr ;
00140   
00141   char               __attribute__(( __unused__ )) funcname[] = "nfs4_op_readdir" ;
00142     
00143   unsigned long              dircount;
00144   unsigned long              maxcount ;
00145   entry4 *                   entry_nfs_array ;
00146   cache_inode_dir_entry_t  * dirent_array;
00147   verifier4                  cookie_verifier;
00148   unsigned int               cookie ;
00149   unsigned int               end_cookie ;
00150   unsigned int             * cookie_array ;
00151   fsal_handle_t            * entry_FSALhandle ;
00152   nfs_fh4                    entryFH ;
00153   char                       val_fh[NFS4_FHSIZE] ;
00154   entry_name_array_item_t  * entry_name_array;
00155   unsigned long             space_used;
00156   unsigned int              estimated_num_entries;
00157   unsigned int              num_entries ;
00158 
00159   unsigned int              i = 0 ;
00160 
00161   bitmap4   RdAttrErrorBitmap ;
00162   attrlist4 RdAttrErrorVals   ;
00163     
00164   resp->resop = NFS4_OP_READDIR ;
00165   res_READDIR4.status =  NFS4_OK  ;
00166 
00167   entryFH.nfs_fh4_len = 0 ;
00168   entryFH.nfs_fh4_val = val_fh ;
00169   
00170   /* If there is no FH */
00171   if( nfs4_Is_Fh_Empty( &(data->currentFH  ) ) )
00172     {
00173       res_READDIR4.status = NFS4ERR_NOFILEHANDLE ;
00174       return res_READDIR4.status ; 
00175     }
00176   
00177   /* If the filehandle is invalid */
00178   if( nfs4_Is_Fh_Invalid( &(data->currentFH ) ) )
00179     {
00180       res_READDIR4.status = NFS4ERR_BADHANDLE ;
00181       return res_READDIR4.status ;
00182     }
00183       
00184   /* Tests if the Filehandle is expired (for volatile filehandle) */
00185   if( nfs4_Is_Fh_Expired( &(data->currentFH) ) )
00186     {
00187       res_READDIR4.status = NFS4ERR_FHEXPIRED ;
00188       return res_READDIR4.status ;
00189     }
00190   
00191   /* Pseudo Fs management */
00192   if( nfs4_Is_Fh_Pseudo( &(data->currentFH) ) )
00193     return nfs4_op_readdir_pseudo( op, data, resp ) ;
00194   
00195   /* Xattrs management */
00196   if( nfs4_Is_Fh_Xattr( &(data->currentFH) ) )
00197     return nfs4_op_readdir_xattr( op, data, resp ) ;
00198   
00199   /* You can readdir only within a directory */
00200   dir_pentry = data->current_entry ;
00201   if ( data->current_filetype != DIR_BEGINNING && data->current_filetype != DIR_CONTINUE )
00202     {
00203       res_READDIR4.status = NFS4ERR_NOTDIR ;
00204       return res_READDIR4.status ;
00205     }
00206   
00207   /* get the caracteristic value for readdir operation */
00208   dircount = arg_READDIR4.dircount ;
00209   maxcount = arg_READDIR4.maxcount ;
00210   cookie   = (unsigned int)arg_READDIR4.cookie ; 
00211   space_used = sizeof( entry4 ) ;
00212 
00213   /* dircount is considered meaningless by many nfsv4 client (like the CITI one). we use maxcount instead */
00214   estimated_num_entries = maxcount / sizeof( entry4 )  ; /* Estimated_num_entries is probably far too big */
00215   
00216 #ifdef _DEBUG_NFS_V4
00217   printf( "--- nfs4_op_readdir ---> dircount=%u maxcount=%u arg_cookie=%llu cookie=%d estimated_num_entries=%u\n", 
00218           dircount, maxcount, arg_READDIR4.cookie, cookie, estimated_num_entries ) ;
00219 #endif
00220   /* Do not use a cookie of 1 or 2 (reserved values) */
00221   if( cookie == 1 || cookie == 2 ) 
00222     {
00223       res_READDIR4.status = NFS4ERR_BAD_COOKIE ;
00224       return res_READDIR4.status ;
00225     }
00226  
00227   if( cookie != 0 ) cookie = cookie -2 ; /* 0,1 and 2 are reserved, there is a delta of '3' because of this */
00228    
00229    /* Get only attributes that are allowed to be read */
00230   if( !nfs4_Fattr_Check_Access_Bitmap( &arg_READDIR4.attr_request, FATTR4_ATTR_READ ) )
00231     {
00232       res_READDIR4.status = NFS4ERR_INVAL ;
00233       return res_READDIR4.status ;
00234     }
00235  
00236 
00237   /* If maxcount is too short, return NFS4ERR_TOOSMALL */
00238   if( maxcount < sizeof( entry4 ) || estimated_num_entries == 0  )
00239     {
00240       res_READDIR4.status = NFS4ERR_TOOSMALL ;
00241       return res_READDIR4.status ;
00242     }
00243   
00244   /*
00245    * If cookie verifier is used, then an non-trivial value is
00246    * returned to the client         This value is the mtime of
00247    * the pentry. If verifier is unused (as in many NFS
00248    * Servers) then only a set of zeros is returned (trivial
00249    * value) 
00250    */
00251   memset(cookie_verifier, 0, NFS4_VERIFIER_SIZE ) ;
00252   if( data->pexport->UseCookieVerifier == 1 )
00253       memcpy(cookie_verifier, &dir_pentry->internal_md.mod_time, sizeof( time_t ) ) ;
00254       
00255   /* Cookie delivered by the server and used by the client SHOULD not ne 0, 1 or 2 (cf RFC3530, page192)
00256    * because theses value are reserved for special use.
00257    *      0 - cookie for first READDIR
00258    *      1 - reserved for . on client handside
00259    *      2 - reserved for .. on client handside
00260    * Entries '.' and '..' are not returned also
00261    * For these reason, there will be an offset of 3 between NFS4 cookie and HPSS cookie */
00262   
00263   if( ( cookie !=0  ) && ( data->pexport->UseCookieVerifier == 1 ) )
00264     {
00265       if(  memcmp(cookie_verifier, arg_READDIR4.cookieverf, NFS4_VERIFIER_SIZE  ) != 0 )
00266         {
00267           
00268           res_READDIR4.status = NFS4ERR_BAD_COOKIE ;
00269           return  res_READDIR4.status ;
00270         }
00271     }
00272 
00273   /* The default behaviour is to consider that eof is not reached, the returned values by cache_inode_readdir 
00274    * will let us know if eod was reached or not */
00275   res_READDIR4.READDIR4res_u.resok4.reply.eof = FALSE ;
00276   
00277   /* Get prepared for readdir */
00278   if( ( dirent_array = (cache_inode_dir_entry_t *)Mem_Alloc(estimated_num_entries * sizeof( cache_inode_dir_entry_t ) ) ) == NULL )
00279     {
00280       res_READDIR4.status = NFS4ERR_SERVERFAULT ;
00281       return res_READDIR4.status;
00282     }
00283   
00284   if( ( cookie_array = (unsigned int *)Mem_Alloc( estimated_num_entries * sizeof( unsigned int ) ) ) == NULL )
00285     {
00286       Mem_Free( (char *)dirent_array ) ;
00287 
00288       res_READDIR4.status = NFS4ERR_SERVERFAULT ;
00289       return res_READDIR4.status;
00290     }
00291 
00292   /* Perform the readdir operation */
00293   if( cache_inode_readdir(dir_pentry, 
00294                           cookie,
00295                           estimated_num_entries, 
00296                           &num_entries, 
00297                           &end_cookie,
00298                           &eod_met,
00299                           dirent_array, 
00300                           cookie_array,
00301                           data->ht, 
00302                           data->pclient,
00303                           data->pcontext, 
00304                           &cache_status) != CACHE_INODE_SUCCESS )
00305     {
00306       res_READDIR4.status = nfs4_Errno( cache_status ) ;
00307       return res_READDIR4.status;
00308     }
00309   
00310   if( eod_met == END_OF_DIR )
00311     {
00312       /* This is the end of the directory */
00313       res_READDIR4.READDIR4res_u.resok4.reply.eof = TRUE ;
00314       memcpy( res_READDIR4.READDIR4res_u.resok4.cookieverf, cookie_verifier, NFS4_VERIFIER_SIZE ) ;
00315     }
00316   
00317     
00318 
00319   /* For an empty directory, we will find only . and .., so reply af if the end if reached */
00320   if( num_entries == 0 )
00321     {
00322       /* only . and .. */
00323       res_READDIR4.READDIR4res_u.resok4.reply.entries = NULL ;
00324       res_READDIR4.READDIR4res_u.resok4.reply.eof = TRUE ;
00325       memcpy( res_READDIR4.READDIR4res_u.resok4.cookieverf, cookie_verifier, NFS4_VERIFIER_SIZE ) ;
00326     }
00327   else
00328     {
00329       /* Allocation of reply structures */
00330       if( ( entry_name_array = (entry_name_array_item_t *)Mem_Alloc(num_entries * (FSAL_MAX_NAME_LEN + 1) ) ) == NULL )
00331         {
00332           DisplayErrorLog( ERR_SYS, ERR_MALLOC, errno ) ;
00333           res_READDIR4.status = NFS4ERR_SERVERFAULT ;
00334           return res_READDIR4.status;
00335         }
00336       memset( (char *)entry_name_array, 0, num_entries * (FSAL_MAX_NAME_LEN + 1) ) ;
00337 
00338 
00339       if( ( entry_nfs_array = (entry4 *)Mem_Alloc(num_entries * sizeof( entry4 ) ) ) == NULL )
00340         {
00341           DisplayErrorLog( ERR_SYS, ERR_MALLOC, errno ) ;
00342           res_READDIR4.status = NFS4ERR_SERVERFAULT ;
00343           return res_READDIR4.status;
00344         }
00345 
00346 
00347       for( i = 0 ; i < num_entries ; i ++ )
00348         {
00349           entry_nfs_array[i].name.utf8string_val =  entry_name_array[i] ;
00350  
00351           if( str2utf8( dirent_array[i].name.name, &entry_nfs_array[i].name ) == -1 )
00352             {
00353               res_READDIR4.status = NFS4ERR_SERVERFAULT ;
00354               return res_READDIR4.status;
00355             }
00356           
00357           /* Set the cookie value */
00358           if( i != num_entries -1 )
00359             entry_nfs_array[i].cookie = cookie_array[i+1] + 2 ; /* 0, 1 and 2 are reserved */
00360           else
00361             entry_nfs_array[i].cookie = end_cookie + 2 ;
00362 
00363 #ifdef _DEBUG_NFS_V4
00364           printf( " === nfs4_op_readdir ===>   i=%d name=%s cookie=%llu\n", 
00365                   i, dirent_array[i].name.name, entry_nfs_array[i].cookie ) ;
00366 #endif
00367 
00368           /* Get the pentry for the object's attributes and filehandle */
00369           if( ( pentry = cache_inode_lookup( dir_pentry, 
00370                                              &dirent_array[i].name,
00371                                              &attrlookup,
00372                                              data->ht, 
00373                                              data->pclient, 
00374                                              data->pcontext,
00375                                              &cache_status ) ) == NULL )
00376             {
00377               Mem_Free( (char *)entry_nfs_array ) ;
00378               Mem_Free( (char *)dirent_array ) ;
00379               Mem_Free( (char *)cookie_array ) ;
00380               /* Return the fattr4_rdattr_error , cf RFC3530, page 192 */
00381               entry_nfs_array[i].attrs.attrmask  = RdAttrErrorBitmap ;
00382               entry_nfs_array[i].attrs.attr_vals = RdAttrErrorVals ;
00383               res_READDIR4.status = NFS4ERR_SERVERFAULT ;
00384               return res_READDIR4.status;
00385             }
00386 
00387            /* If file handle is asked in the attributes, provide it */
00388           if( arg_READDIR4.attr_request.bitmap4_val != NULL && (arg_READDIR4.attr_request.bitmap4_val[0] & FATTR4_FILEHANDLE) )
00389             {
00390              if( ( entry_FSALhandle = cache_inode_get_fsal_handle( pentry, &cache_status_attr ) ) == NULL )
00391                {
00392                  /* Faulty Handle or pentry */
00393                   Mem_Free( (char *)entry_nfs_array ) ;
00394                   Mem_Free( (char *)dirent_array ) ;
00395                   Mem_Free( (char *)cookie_array ) ;
00396                   res_READDIR4.status = NFS4ERR_SERVERFAULT ;
00397                   return res_READDIR4.status;
00398                 }
00399 
00400              if( !nfs4_FSALToFhandle( &entryFH, entry_FSALhandle, data ) )
00401                 {
00402                   /* Faulty type */
00403                   Mem_Free( (char *)entry_nfs_array ) ;
00404                   Mem_Free( (char *)dirent_array ) ;
00405                   Mem_Free( (char *)cookie_array ) ;
00406                   res_READDIR4.status = NFS4ERR_SERVERFAULT ;
00407                   return res_READDIR4.status;
00408                 }
00409             }
00410           
00411           if( nfs4_FSALattr_To_Fattr( data->pexport,
00412                                       &attrlookup, 
00413                                       &(entry_nfs_array[i].attrs), 
00414                                       data,
00415                                       &entryFH,
00416                                       &(arg_READDIR4.attr_request) ) != 0 )
00417             {
00418               /* Return the fattr4_rdattr_error , cf RFC3530, page 192 */
00419               entry_nfs_array[i].attrs.attrmask  = RdAttrErrorBitmap ;
00420               entry_nfs_array[i].attrs.attr_vals = RdAttrErrorVals ;
00421             } 
00422 
00423           /* Chain the entries together */ 
00424           entry_nfs_array[i].nextentry = NULL;
00425           if( i != 0 ) 
00426             entry_nfs_array[i-1].nextentry = &(entry_nfs_array[i]); 
00427 
00428           /* This test is there to avoid going further than the buffer provided by the client 
00429            * the factor "9/10" is there for safety. Its value could be change as beta tests will be done */
00430           if( (caddr_t)((caddr_t)(&entry_nfs_array[i]) - (caddr_t)(&entry_nfs_array[0])) > (caddr_t)(maxcount*9/10) )
00431              break ;
00432         } /* for i */
00433 
00434       
00435       /* Put the entry's list in the READDIR reply */
00436       res_READDIR4.READDIR4res_u.resok4.reply.entries = entry_nfs_array ;
00437     }    
00438   
00439   /* Do not forget to set the verifier */
00440   memcpy( (char *)res_READDIR4.READDIR4res_u.resok4.cookieverf, cookie_verifier, NFS4_VERIFIER_SIZE ) ;
00441 
00442   Mem_Free( (char *)dirent_array ) ;
00443   Mem_Free( (char *)cookie_array ) ;
00444   res_READDIR4.status = NFS4_OK ;
00445   
00446   return res_READDIR4.status;
00447 } /* nfs4_op_readdir */
00448 
00449     
00460 void nfs4_op_readdir_Free( READDIR4res * resp )
00461 {
00462   entry4 * entries ;
00463   
00464   if( resp->status == NFS4_OK )
00465     {
00466       for( entries = resp->READDIR4res_u.resok4.reply.entries; entries != NULL ; entries = entries->nextentry )
00467         {
00468           Mem_Free( (char *)entries->attrs.attrmask.bitmap4_val ) ; 
00470         }
00471 
00472       if( resp->READDIR4res_u.resok4.reply.entries != NULL )
00473        {
00474          Mem_Free( (char *)resp->READDIR4res_u.resok4.reply.entries[0].name.utf8string_val ) ; 
00475          Mem_Free( (char *)resp->READDIR4res_u.resok4.reply.entries ) ;
00476        }
00477     }
00478   
00479   return ;
00480 } /* nfs4_op_readdir_Free */
Generated on Tue Mar 31 14:37:44 2009 for NFS and Mount protocols layer by  1.5.7.1
